articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Knife-wielding prisoners identifying themselves as Islamic State militants staged a bloody attack on guards in a Russian penal colony on Friday and seized hostages, according to state media and news outlets with ties to the security services.
articles.title: Islamist prisoners slash guards, seize hostages in Russian jail

articles.author: Ismail Shakil, Stephanie Kelly
articles.description: Independent presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr. abanonded his campaign on Friday and endorsed Republican Donald Trump, ending a presidential bid that he began as a Democrat trading on one of the most famous names in American politics.
articles.title: RFK Jr ends US presidential campaign, endorses Trump

articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: President Joe Biden spoke by phone to the leaders of Qatar and Egypt on Friday, pushing for an elusive Gaza ceasefire-for-hostages deal as negotiators met in Cairo to try to overcome remaining obstacles.
articles.title: Biden speaks to Egypt, Qatar leaders in Gaza ceasefire push

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Pavel Polityuk
articles.description: India's Narendra Modi urged President Volodymyr Zelenskiy on Friday to sit down for talks with Russia to end the war in Ukraine and offered to act as a friend to help bring peace as the two leaders met in wartime Kyiv.
articles.title: In Kyiv, Indian PM urges Zelenskiy to sit down for talks with Russia

articles.author: Allison Lampert, David Ljunggren
articles.description: The union representing workers at Canadian National Railway said on Friday they would strike next week, in a fresh threat to the economy after vowing to challenge a government decision to end an unprecedented rail stoppage.
articles.title: Canada rail shutdown: CN workers to strike Monday

articles.author: Nathan Layne
articles.description: Donald Trump touted his plan to end taxation on tips at a stop in Las Vegas on Friday, trying to turn the page on a week in which he was overshadowed by Kamala Harris and struggled to keep focus on policy issues and not personal attacks on his opponent.
articles.title: Trump struggles to keep media spotlight in battle with Harris

articles.author: Deisy Buitrago, Vivian Sequera
articles.description: Former Venezuelan presidential candidate Edmundo Gonzalez will be asked to testify about an opposition website where voting tallies from a disputed July election are posted, attorney general Tarek Saab said on Friday.
articles.title: Venezuela opposition leader Gonzalez to be called to testify about vote tally website, AG says

articles.author: Daniel Trotta
articles.description: A second former Memphis police officer pleaded guilty on Friday to federal charges in the death of Black motorist Tyre Nichols, whose videotaped beating by five Black officers in January 2023 shocked the United States.
articles.title: Second Memphis police officer pleads guilty in death of Tyre Nichols

articles.author: Brad Brooks
articles.description: A former Florida sheriff's deputy was charged on Friday with manslaughter in the shooting death of a Black man who responded to a knock on his apartment door, prosecutors said.
articles.title: Former Florida deputy charged in killing of Black man

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: Former Donald Trump advisor Steve Bannon must face trial in New York on criminal-fraud charges over a push to fund the former U.S. president's signature wall along the U.S.-Mexico border, a judge ruled on Friday.
articles.title: Former Trump advisor Steve Bannon must face NY criminal fraud trial, judge rules
